item.title: Should You Open Ho-Oh Packs or Lugia Packs First in Pokemon TCG Pocket?
item.description:
Just like the three that came before it, the Wisdom of Sea and Sky expansion is broken up into multiple packs. As a result, Pokemon TCG Pocket players will need to decide whether they want to open Lugia packs or Ho-Oh packs, with each containing its fair share of exclusive cards.

Over time, players will likely end up opening both packs in equal measure, but, to begin with, most will probably want to prioritize one pack over the other. The following guide aims to make it easier to decide whether to open Ho-Oh or Lugia packs first in Pokemon TCG Pocket .

Should You Open Ho-Oh Packs or Lugia Packs in Pokemon TCG Pocket?

  • All Ho-Oh Pack ex Cards

    1. Ho-Oh ex (A4 034 / 187 / 210 / 240)
    2. Donphan ex (A4 100 / 191 / 206)
    3. Crobat ex (A4 109 / 192 / 207)
    4. Umbreon ex (A4 112 / 193 / 208)
    5. Skarmory ex (A4 124 / 194 / 209)
    6. Yanmega ex (A4 232)
    7. Leafeon ex (A4 233)
    8. Mismagius ex (A4 237)
    9. Lickilicky ex (A4 239)

  • All Lugia Pack ex Cards

    1. Shuckle ex (A4 021 / 186 / 202)
    2. Kingdra ex (A4 043 / 188 / 203)
    3. Lanturn ex (A4 065 / 189 / 204)
    4. Espeon ex (A4 083 / 190 / 205)
    5. Lugia ex (A4 149 / 195 / 211 / 241)
    6. Gyarados ex (A4 234)
    7. Glaceon ex (A4 235)
    8. Pachirisu ex (A4 236)
    9. Weavile ex (A4 238)

When trying to decide whether to open Lugia or Ho-Oh packs, Pokemon TCG Pocket players will want to focus on the ex cards that each pack contains and how well those cards synergize with their existing decks and playstyle. Most will likely deduce that Ho-Oh packs are better than Lugia packs due to how well Crobat ex and Umbreon ex pair with some of the existing cards. And, while Ho-Oh ex and Lugia ex are clearly designed with each other in mind, the former can be very useful without the latter. Its ability to generate three energy per turn from three colorless energy means that it can work well with colorless attackers or hard-hitting Dragon-types like Genetic Appex Dragonite.

When trying to decide whether to open Lugia or Ho-Oh packs first, it can help to draw up a ranked list of the cards that you want most. It's also a good idea to keep an eye on how many of the rare cards from a pack you've already pulled, as this can make it a lot easier to know when it's best to switch.

All Exclusive Cards in Lugia and Ho-Oh Packs

Both Ho-Oh and Lugia packs contain 105 exclusive cards. In addition to these, there are 31 cards that can appear in both, for a total of 136 potential cards in each pack. It's worth noting, though, that while the gold crown variants of Ho-Oh ex and Lugia ex can technically appear in both packs via the fifth slot, players are far more likely to pull them from their respective packs, so anyone who is chasing those two cards specifically should definitely keep this in mind.

item.title: How To Get The Starseed Teleporter In The Sims 4
item.description:
As players explore Innisgreen, the world of fairies, they will discover some useful items like the Starseed Teleporter in The Sims 4 . You have to complete a certain Fable in order to unlock it and use it freely.

How To Get The Starseed Teleporter In The Sims 4

To get the Starseed Teleporter in The Sims 4 , players must complete the Stubborn Misfortune Fable for Care Ren . You can find the Fabulist in Everdew walking around near the Fairy Council building. Speak with her and choose to Acquire a Fable to see the available options. She only has two and one of them is locked until you complete the Stubborn Misfortune. Accept the Fable and start looking for a fairy to complete it.

Once you find one, ask them for a Bottle of Emotion and then deliver it to Care Ren to complete the Stubborn Misfortune Fable. If the options are not there, try to increase your friendship with the fairy and ask again. Finishing the Fable rewards a couple of seeds, and most importantly, a Starseed Teleporter.

How To Use The Starseed Teleporter In The Sims 4

The Starseed Teleporter is used to quickly travel to a hidden world in The Sims 4 . You can teleport alone or with other Sims, but keep in mind that traveling requires Fairy Dust. This will definitely help Simmers as they would usually have to go through many steps and wait days in-game before attempting to enter any of these worlds. Here are the available locations:

Hidden World

Description

Expansion Pack

Sylvan Glade

The lush hidden forest found in Willow Creek.

Base Game

Forgotten Grotto

The hidden cave found in Oasis Springs.

Base Game

The Magic Realm

The arcane world whose portal resides in Glimmerbook.

Realm of Magic

Teleport to Sixam

Sixam, the Alien World in the far reaches of Space.

Get to Work

Mt. Komorebi Peak

The highest peak of the snow-covered Mt. Komorebi.

Snowy Escape

If you wish to visit these hidden worlds without the hassle of completing a Fable, it's still possible. Just go to Everdew and there will be a Starseed Teleporter in the open world available for everyone. Just make sure you have some Fairy Dust in The Sims 4 . Being a fairy makes it easy to get some dust, as being a normal Sims means you have to ask fairy for dust, or shake some fairy homes. You can also try purchasing it as it's considered an Apothecary ingredient.

5 Images

item.title: Ineffa Best Weapons In Genshin Impact
item.description:
When participating in a Lunar-Charged reaction in Genshin Impact , Ineffas Crit value also plays a role in improving the Electro x Hydro reaction. To put it simply, as long as a weapon has Crit value, its a good weapon for Ineffa in Genshin . That being said, other stats and factors can still play a role in making a weapon good for Ineffa, so here are the best weapons for Ineffa in Genshin Impact .

10 Ineffa Best Weapons In Genshin Impact

Here are the best weapons for Ineffa in Genshin Impact :

  • Fractured Halo
  • Calamity Queller
  • Vortex Vanquisher
  • Primordial Jade Winged-Spear
  • Missive Windspear
  • Engulfing Lightning
  • Deathmatch
  • Staff of the Scarlet Sands
  • Symphonist of Scents
  • Lumidouce Elegy
  • Blackcliff Pole
  • Ballad of the Fjords
  • Tamayuratei no Ohanashi
  • Kitain Cross Spear

Ineffa needs at least 2000 ATK to maximize her Lunar-Charged buff, but more than that is still good for her direct Lunar-Charged DMG. For that, focus mainly on ATK and Crit stats when choosing the best weapon for Ineffa in Genshin Impact .

9 Kitain Cross Spear

Primary Stat

565 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

110 Elemental Mastery

R5 Effect

Increases Elemental Skill DMG by 12%. After Elemental Skill hits an opponent, the character loses 3 Energy but regenerates 5 Energy every 2s for the next 6s. This effect can occur once every 10s. Can be triggered even when the character is not on the field.

Kitain Cross Spear is an acceptable F2P weapon for Ineffa in Genshin Impact . While it grants Ineffa high Base ATK alongside some Elemental Mastery for her Lunar-Charged reactions, it also helps manage her Energy by slowly regenerating it for six seconds after using her Elemental Skill.

8 Tamayuratei no Ohanashi

Primary Stat

565 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

30.6% Energy Recharge

R5 Effect

Increase ATK by 40% and Movement SPD by 10% for 10s when using an Elemental Skill.

Tamayuratei no Ohanashi is one of Ineffas best F2P Polearms in Genshin Impact . It offers her a high Base ATK to improve her ATK% scaling and Energy Recharge Sub-stat to help Ineffa cast her Elemental Burst more often. Thats not where it ends, as Tamayuratei no Ohanashi also increases Ineffas ATK by up to 40%, which is exactly what she needs when she has high Base ATK like that.

7 Deathmatch

Primary Stat

510 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

36.8% Crit Rate

R5 Effect

If there are at least 2 opponents nearby, ATK is increased by 32% and DEF is increased by 32%. If there are fewer than 2 opponents nearby, ATK is increased by 48%.

Going into the premium options, Deathmatch is an excellent 4-star weapon for Ineffa in Genshin Impact . Simply because any weapon that offers Crit value will always be a good choice, since she needs Crit in her attacks and reactions.

Similarly, other Crit-centric Polearms like Staff of the Scarlet Sands , Lumidouce Elegy , Symphonist of Scents , Blackcliff Pole , and Ballad of the Fjords are also viable Crit weapons for Ineffa in Genshin Impact .

6 Engulfing Lightning

Primary Stat

608 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

55.1% Energy Recharge

Effect

ATK increased by 28% of Energy Recharge over the base 100%. You can gain a maximum bonus of 80% ATK. Gain 30% Energy Recharge for 12s after using an Elemental Burst.

Engulfing Lightning helps Ineffa cast her Elemental Burst more often. Not only that, but Ineffa will start getting ATK% based on the amount of Energy Recharge she has. While some other 4-star options perform better, its still a decent 5-star weapon that grants Ineffa a lot of Energy Recharge and ATK%.

5 Missive Windspear

Primary Stat

510 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

41.3% ATK

R5 Effect

Within 10s after an Elemental Reaction is triggered, ATK is increased by 24% and Elemental Mastery is increased by 96.

Missive Windspear ranks above most other 4-star weapons because of its ability to buff everything Ineffa needs. Starting from the weapons Secondary Stat, Missive Windspear has an ATK% Sub-stat that pairs nicely with the weapons passive effect, which also increases Ineffas ATK%. It also grants Ineffa Elemental Mastery, which further improves her role in most Ineffa Genshin Impact teams.

4 Primordial Jade Winged-Spear

Primary Stat

674 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

22.1% Crit Rate

Effect

On hit, increases ATK by 3.2% for 6s. Max 7 stacks. This effect can only occur once every 0.3s. While in possession of the maximum possible stacks, DMG dealt is increased by 12%.

Primordial Jade Winged-Spear is a very good 5-star weapon for Ineffa, especially if she's operating as an on-field DPS. As long as shes hitting enemies, her ATK% will keep increasing, and that greatly improves her DPS and utility as a support in Genshin Impact . Moreover, Ineffa also gets high Base ATK and Crit Rate from Primordial Jade Winged-Spears Sub-stat.

3 Vortex Vanquisher

Primary Stat

608 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

49.6% ATK

Effect

Increases Shield Strength by 20%. Scoring hits on opponents increases ATK by 4% for 8s. Max 5 stacks. Can only occur once every 0.3s. While protected by a shield, this ATK increase effect is increased by 100%.

Vortex Vanquisher is a slightly better option than Primordial Jade Winged-Spear for a main DPS Ineffa because of the massive ATK% buff that it grants her. While Ineffa will lose Primordial Jades Crit Rate Sub-stat, she gains an insane amount of ATK% while shielded and an improved shield strength. Ineffa can easily summon a shield and keep it up for 100% of the time during combat. Not only that, but she also scales with ATK% to increase her shields DMG absorption. Finally, Zhonglis Signature weapon has a use in Genshin Impact .

2 Calamity Queller

Primary Stat

741 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

16.5% ATK

Effect

Gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus. Obtain Consummation for 20s after using an Elemental Skill, causing ATK to increase by 3.2% per second. This ATK increase has a maximum of 6 stacks. When the character equipped with this weapon is not on the field, Consummation's ATK increase is doubled.

As a character that greatly relies on ATK%, theres no better alternative than Calamity Queller in Genshin Impact . The 5-star Shenhe Signature weapon grants Ineffa a significant increase in her Base ATK, which scales perfectly with any ATK% she will get after. Just remember that it may be difficult to balance Ineffa's Crit value with ATK-centric weapons like Calamity Queller and Vortex Vanquisher.

1 Fractured Halo

Primary Stat

608 Base ATK

Secondary Stat

66.2% Crit DMG

Effect

After an Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst is used, ATK is increased by 24% for 20s. If the equipping character creates a Shield while this effect is active, they will gain the Electrifying Edict effect for 20s: All nearby party members deal 40% more Lunar-Charged DMG.

While Ineffa works with a lot of weapons, especially the F2P ones, theres still a notable difference when using her Signature weapon in Genshin Impact .

Fractured Halo grants Ineffa the standard 5-star Base ATK, alongside 66% Crit DMG. It also increases her ATK% with a 100% uptime, since its easy for her to keep casting Elemental Skill and Burst every 20 seconds. Finally, Ineffa can also keep her shield active for the entire combat duration, and that gives access to an endless 40% extra Lunar-Charged DMG buff.

item.title: Umamusume Pretty Derby - Swinging Maestro Skill Explained
item.description:
Skills are incredibly important in Umamusume: Pretty Derby , and the general consensus among the community is that Swinging Maestro is one of the strongest skills in the game. This unassuming Umamusume stamina recovery skill can greatly enhance the performance of basically any character, and it's a must-have for most builds.

There are plenty of energy recovery skills in Umamusume , however, so what sets Swinging Maestro apart from the others? It's a rare ability from an SSR Support Card, but there are similar SSR Support Card abilities that aren't nearly as sought after as Swinging Maestro. What makes it so special, and how do you get Swinging Maestro for your Umamusume?

How to Get Swinging Maestro in Umamusume

Swinging Maestro is unlocked via a career event from the Super Creek SSR Support Card in Umamusume: Pretty Derby . If you bring Super Creek in your Support Card deck, you'll get skill hints and unlock Swinging Maestro whenever the associated event occurs.

It's an improved version of the Corner Recovery skill, so unlocking that will reduce the skill point cost of Swinging Maestro significantly. It's well worth the upgrade, though, and Swinging Maestro will basically take care of all your stamina recovery needs.

Why is Swinging Maestro So Good in Umamusume?

Swinging Maestro is the best energy recovery skill in Umamusume: Pretty Derby . That alone is enough to make it valuable, but it's also the lack of restrictions that truly makes it one of the game's best Support Card abilities. Swinging Maestro randomly recovers energy when your Umamusume is running along a corner . There are so many corners on every track especially if you run longer distances so it has a chance of activating for most of the race.

In addition, there aren't any other criteria to fulfill for Swinging Maestro to activate. You don't have to choose a specific racing style like Pace Chaser or Front Runner, and you don't have to be on a specific track type or distance. It works in every scenario . It's unbelievably strong for both career mode and PVP Team Trials.

All of these things combine to create one of the strongest skills in Umamusume: Pretty Derby . You can borrow a Support Card from another player before starting a career, so it's highly recommended to steal someone else's Super Creek card just to get Swinging Maestro. People share their Friend IDs all the time online, so you shouldn't have much trouble finding someone who has a MLB Super Creek Support Card for you to use.

item.title: Ineffa Build In Genshin Impact
item.description:
Ineffa is one of the first Nod-Krai characters in Genshin Impact . She joins the roster with an exciting new mechanic where she turns Electro-charged reactions into Lunar-charged. The best part about the Lunar-charged reaction is its scaling with Crit and its unique DMG calculation. So, for players who are pulling for Ineffa and want the best version of her Lunar-charged reactions, here are the best builds for Ineffa in Genshin Impact .

Ineffa Build In Genshin Impact

Weapons

Artifact Sets

Stats

  1. Fractured Halo
  2. Calamity Queller
  3. Vortex Vanquisher
  4. Primordial Jade Winged-Spear
  5. Missive Windspear
  6. Engulfing Lightning
  7. Deathmatch
  8. Staff of the Scarlet Sands
  9. Symphonist of Scents
  10. Lumidouce Elegy
  11. Blackcliff Pole
  12. Ballad of the Fjords
  13. Tamayuratei no Ohanashi
  14. Kitain Cross Spear

  • Gilded Dreams
  • Tenacity of the Millelith
  • Flower of Paradise Lost

  • Timepiece: ATK
  • Goblet: ATK
  • Circlet: Crit Rate or Crit DMG
  • Sub-stat: Crit Rate, Crit DMG, ATK, and Energy Recharge.

Ineffa Best Artifacts In Genshin Impact

As an Electro user who gives access to Lunar-charged reactions in Genshin Impact , Ineffa has a decent amount of choices when it comes to her best artifact sets. To build Ineffa to deal the most DMG, build her with the Gilded Dreams set. It gives her ATK% and Elemental Mastery, which is all she needs to increase her team buff and Lunar-charged DMG.

Additionally, with the Gilded Dreams set, Ineffa can play any role in any team. She can operate as an on-field main DPS or an off-field Sub-DPS. She can also participate in Lunar-charged teams or even Hyperbloom teams in Genshin Impact .

You can also build Ineffa more of a Support unit in Genshin Impact by giving her the Tenacity of the Millelith set. She enables the Lunar-charged reaction anyway, so she can easily stay off-field while her Smart Assistance Unit, Birgitta, keeps dealing off-field Electro and Lunar-charged reactions DMG. The idea behind building Ineffa with the Tenacity of the Millelith set is to further buff the teams ATK% alongside all the other buffs Ineffa offers in her kit.

Finally, if you include Ineffa in Hyperbloom teams, with her being the only Hyperbloom trigger, it gives a lot of value to building her with the Flower of Paradise Lost set. Ineffas Hyperbloom DMG will increase with every Hyperbloom reaction she triggers, even if shes off-field. Keep in mind, as the only Electro unit in the team, building Ineffa on more Elemental Mastery becomes as important as building her on ATK% since shes always going to participate in every Lunar-charged and trigger every Hyperbloom reactions.

In general, as a character that scales with ATK% with everything shes trying to do, its important to build Ineffa with as much ATK% as possible. So, give her ATK% on her Timepiece and Goblet instead of Electro DMG. As for her Circlet , its still better to increase Ineffas Crit value instead of giving her ATK, since she deals a considerable amount of off-field Electro DMG. Not to mention, Lunar-charged reactions can Crit, which increases the importance of having a high Crit value when building Ineffa in Genshin Impact .

Although Lunar-charged reactions mainly scale with Elemental mastery, its still more important to build Ineffa on more ATK% than Elemental Mastery . This is because her first Ascension Passive gives her unlimited access to direct Lunar-charged reactions that scale directly with her ATK%.

Ineffa Best Polearms In Genshin Impact

Given her versatile gameplay and mechanics, Ineffa works with tons of Polearms in Genshin Impact . Fractured Halo is her best-in-slot weapon and can notably enhance her DPS and supportive capabilities. Fractured Halo grants Ineffa the ability to increase her ATK% and her teams Lunar-charged DMG with a 100% uptime.

Ineffa can work with similar weapons that keep increasing her ATK% when shes off-field, like Calamity Queller , Engulfing Lightning , and Symphonist of Scents . Calamity Queller gives her a massive amount of Base ATK and ATK% at the cost of losing some of her Crit value. Engulfing Lightning fulfills Ineffas Energy Recharge requirement while increasing her ATK%. As for Symphonist of Scents, Ineffa doesnt have access to the 5-star Polearms entire passive effect, but she gets enough to make the weapon among the best options for her.

Vortex Vanquisher is an excellent on-field alternative weapon for Ineffa, as it works to massively increase Ineffas ATK% when shes shielded, which is an easy requirement for her. You can also build Ineffa with 5-star weapons like Primordial Jade or Staff of Homa to enhance her Crit value and ATK%. Deathmatch also enhances the same style of gameplay as a 4-star weapon.

Finally, F2P Ineffa builds work with a wide variety of 4-star Polearms like Kitain Cross Spear , Prospector's Drill , Tamayuratei no Ohanashi , and Missive Windspear , which is one of the best options when building F2P Ineffa in Genshin Impact .
